page_analysis.text_content:
Driveway standards

• Driveway surfaces may have either permeable or impermeable paving. Materials shall meet Public Works standards.

• Driveway surface within 10' of the public right-of-way may not be of a loose material e.g., gravel.

• 2nd dwelling units must share common driveway with main dwelling.

• Minimum driveway clearance: 10'

• Minimum driveway surface: 8'

• Minimum 20' between curb cuts.

• No more than 40% of required front yard may be impermeable.

• Street-work permit required for work done within the public right-of-way.

For safety reasons, the city also encourages that the following standard be met:

• No more than one curb cut per single frontage.

• Minimum of 50' between curb cut and intersection curb face.

Fig 31 Driveway standards

Pavers without mortar (grass between) OK

"Hollywood strips" (grass between) OK

Gravel OK

Turns enroute to required parking spaces must be deemed maneuverable by the Transportation Division.

8' min. width for driveway surface (typ. all)

10' min. width for driveway clearance (typ. all)

No gravel or similar loose materials within 10' of the public right-of-way (lot line)

Work done within the public ROW requires a street-work permit and must comply with city standards.

36

visual_elements.description: Technical diagram showing three different driveway surface types with cross-sectional views. Left shows pavers without mortar with grass between (labeled OK), middle shows 'Hollywood strips' with grass between (labeled OK), and right shows gravel surface (labeled OK). Each has a curved bottom representing the street connection.

Detailed technical cross-section diagram of a driveway showing various measurements and specifications. Shows gravel surface area, required clearances, and connection to public right-of-way. Includes dimensional arrows and labels for 8' minimum width, 10' minimum clearance, and 10' restriction zone for loose materials.
